main event: An unidentified flying object was observed near Washington, D.C. for approximately 15 minutes on July 10, 1964.
interesting points: The object appeared brighter than Venus and could not be relocated., The object made no sound during the observation., Observers included children along with the main witness., The report concluded that the object might have been a high altitude aircraft contrail., The witness was an amateur astronomer and electronics engineer with a B.S. in physics.
sighted object: unknown bright object in the sky
witness description: A 40-year-old male amateur astronomer and electronics engineer, along with children.
